definitions.definition: a long narrow hilltop, mountain range, or watershed.
the line or edge formed where the two sloping sides of a roof meet at the top.
an elongated region of high atmospheric pressure.
a narrow raised band running along or across a surface.
examples: buff your nails in order to smooth ridges

definitions.definition: a raised strip of arable land, especially (in medieval open fields) one of a set separated by furrows.
mark with or form into narrow raised bands.
examples: the ridged sand of the beach

definitions.definition: (of a surface) form into or rise up as a narrow raised band.
examples: the crust of the earth ridged

definitions.definition: form (arable land) into raised strips separated by furrows.
examples: a field plowed in narrow stretches that are ridged up slightly
